result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Todd P Piper in court with attorney Andrew Walter.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
Defendant Todd P Piper in court with attorney Andrew Walter.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
BOND QUASHED

2:30 PM FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  
Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Todd P Piper in court with attorney Andrew Walter.  
Matter is scheduled for JT next week Monday and Tuesday.  
Court inquires if parties have reached an agreement.  
Attorney Walter informs the Court that there was a Motion to Suppress previously filed but never heard. The Motion had been scheduled for hearing in October of last year but was withdrawn because the parties were negotiating and believed they would have an agreement.  The Defendant ended up not qualifying for treatment Court and have not reached any agreement in this matter.  Court will CANCEL next week's Jury Trial and schedule the Motion for hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Todd P Piper in court with attorney Andrew Walter.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Todd P Piper in court with attorney Andrew Walter.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant Todd P Piper in court with attorney Andrew Walter.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

10:09 a.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  Defendant Todd P Piper in court with attorney Andrew Walter.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is before the Court for hearing on the Defendant's Motion to Suppress.  Attorney Walter advises that they are withdrawing their Motion.  Parties have been negotiating and believe they may have an agreement.  The matter remains on for Final pre-trial on November 23rd at 2:30 p.m. but the parties may ask to have this put on the calendar prior to that date if an agreement is reached.  10:10 a.m.  Court in recess.
State's Brief in Response to the Defendant's Motion to Supress Fruits of Unconstitutional Traffic Stop
By Fax
Motion hearing at 10-20-2015 10:00 am
Motion to Suppress Fruits of Unconstitutional Traffic Stop

Defendant Todd P Piper in court with attorney Andrew Walter.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Todd P Piper in court with attorney Andrew Walter.   Atty Rea and Intern M. Fagan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not Guilty plea entered. Minutes Filed.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Authorization to Appear and Act
Invocation of Right to Counsel
Application for Jail Time Credit form
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant Todd P Piper in court with attorney Andrew Walter.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court, Stayed warrant not issued.  Minutes filed.  Arraignment scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND COVERS 15CF185 AND15CT137
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Todd P. Piper not in court, attorney Andrew Walter appeared.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant authorized but stayed until 06-10-2015 at 1:15 pm.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
